text: Psalm 24
The King of Glory
A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 24 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness,
\add the\add* world and those who live in it,
because he has founded it on \add the\add* seas,
and has established it on \add the\add* rivers.
Who may ascend \add the\add* mountain of Yahweh?
And who may stand in his holy place?
He who is innocent of hands and pure of heart,
who does not lift up his soul to falseness,
and does not swear deceitfully.
He will receive blessing from Yahweh,
and justice\f + \fr 24:5 \ft Or “vindication” \f* from the God of his salvation.
Such \add is the\add* sort of those who seek\f + \fr 24:6 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere) \ft  \f* him,
those who seek your face, even Jacob. \qs Selah\qs*
Lift up your heads, O gates,
and rise up, O ancient doorways,
that the king of glory\f + \fr 24:7 \ft Literally “the king of the glory” \f* may enter.
Who \add is\add* the king of glory?\f + \fr 24:8 \ft Literally “the king of the glory” \f*
Yahweh, strong and mighty;
Yahweh, mighty in war!
Lift up your heads, O gates,
and lift up, O ancient doorways,
that the king of glory\f + \fr 24:9 \ft Literally “the king of the glory” \f* may enter.
Who is the king of glory?\f + \fr 24:10 \ft Literally “the king of the glory” \f*
Yahweh of hosts,
He \add is\add* the king of glory!\f + \fr 24:10 \ft Literally “the king of the glory” \f* \qs Selah\qs*
